steps.title: Cream together the butter with the sugar until light and moist.
steps.content: Cream together the butter with the sugar until light and moist.

steps.title: Add the vanilla extract and mix it in.
steps.content: Add the vanilla extract and mix it in.

steps.title: Add the eggs (one at a time) to the batter.
steps.content: Add the eggs (one at a time) to the batter. Mix it well. [1] X Research source (It may look like it's curdling but don't worry.)

steps.title: Add the flour with the baking soda and milk.
steps.content: Add the flour with the baking soda and milk. Mix well until all bits of flour disappear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Preheat oven to 350 째F (175 째C).
steps.content: Preheat oven to 350 째F (175 째C). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Line your cupcake pan with cupcake liners.
steps.content: Line your cupcake pan with cupcake liners. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add the batter into the cupcake liners.
steps.content: Add the batter into the cupcake liners. Fill them half up.

steps.title: Bake the cupcakes for 15-20 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the cupcakes for 15-20 minutes. Insert a toothpick and if it comes out clean your cupcakes are done. [5] X Research source Avoid opening the oven in the middle of the baking process. Do it only when it is time to check if your cupcakes are done.

steps.title: Let them cool for a few minutes in the pan then take them out.
steps.content: Let them cool for a few minutes in the pan then take them out.

steps.title: Serve.
steps.content: Serve. Your awesome and delicious cupcakes are done! Frost or ice the cupcakes with your choice of flavored frosting/icing. Don't frost freshly baked warm cupcakes. Make sure that they are completely cold. If you wish, you can even swirl different frostings together as long as they have the same consistence, for example buttercream and chocolate ganache. Or, you can use the same kind of frosting but of different colors. Layer your frostings on a piece of plastic wrap, and then roll it like a sandwich. If you wish, you can put some filling inside your cupcakes. Use an apple corer to make the hole in the cupcake, then fill them with whatever you like using a piping bag.
